metadata.Title: CVE-2017-10067 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
Vulnerability in the Java SE component of Oracle Java SE (subcomponent:Security). Supported versions that are affected are Java SE: 6u151, 7u141and 8u131. Difficult to exploit vulnerability allows unauthenticatedattacker with network access via multiple protocols to compromise Java SE.Successful attacks require human interaction from a person other than theattacker. Successful attacks of this vulnerability can result in takeoverof Java SE. Note: This vulnerability applies to Java deployments, typicallyin clients running sandboxed Java Web Start applications or sandboxed Javaapplets, that load and run untrusted code (e.g., code that comes from theinternet) and rely on the Java sandbox for security. This vulnerabilitydoes not apply to Java deployments, typically in servers, that load and runonly trusted code (e.g., code installed by an administrator). CVSS 3.0 BaseScore 7.5 (Confidentiality, Integrity and Availability impacts). CVSSVector: (CVSS:3.0/AV:N/AC:H/PR:N/UI:R/S:U/C:H/I:H/A:H).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-10067` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openjdk-8-demo - 8u141-b15-1
openjdk-8-jdk - 8u141-b15-1
openjdk-8-jdk-headless - 8u141-b15-1
openjdk-8-jre - 8u141-b15-1
openjdk-8-jre-headless - 8u141-b15-1
openjdk-8-jre-zero - 8u141-b15-1
openjdk-8-source - 8u141-b15-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openjdk-8 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8u141-b15-1').
